intro: Diasperus javanicus, commonly known as the Java thornapple, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hard seeds. Diasperus javanicus is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including open woodlands and grasslands.
